title: 10 Most Sustainable Grocers - Progressive Grocer
summary: ALDI, a leading grocery retailer in the United States, has implemented various sustainability initiatives such as eliminating single-use plastic bags and reducing plastic waste. The company is focused on reducing operational waste, food waste, and harmful refrigerant emissions while promoting sustainable sourcing in its supply chain.
green_innovation: TRUE. This is green innovation as ALDI has implemented various sustainability initiatives with a focus on reducing waste and promoting sustainable practices.
business_innovation: TRUE. ALDI's sustainability initiatives can be considered a business innovation as they represent an improvement in the company's environmental impact and operational processes.
green_product: TRUE. ALDI's commitment to reducing plastic waste, minimizing operational waste, and promoting sustainable sourcing aligns with the definition of a green product.
green_process: TRUE. ALDI's sustainable practices, such as reducing waste, conserving resources, and promoting sustainable sourcing, demonstrate a green process.
likely_naics_codes: Likely NAICS Codes: 445110 - Supermarkets and Other Grocery Stores, 562920 - Materials Recovery Facilities, 551114 - Corporate, Subsidiary, and Regional Managing Offices, 424410 - General Line Grocery Merchant Wholesalers
greenwashing: FALSE. The article text highlights tangible sustainability initiatives and commitments by ALDI, indicating a genuine effort towards environmental responsibility rather than greenwashing.

title: Jack Daniel's and Coca-Cola Ready-to-Drink Launches in the U.S. - All On Georgia
summary: Jack Daniel’s & Coca-Cola RTD, a pre-mixed cocktail, is now available in the U.S., inspired by the popular 'Jack & Coke' cocktail. It features iconic brands Jack Daniel’s and Coca-Cola, with a 7% ABV version and a Zero-Sugar option. The product aims to offer a convenient and portable way for consumers to enjoy the classic cocktail.
green_innovation: FALSE: This product innovation does not contribute to environmental sustainability goals as it focuses on a new market offering rather than reducing environmental externalities.
business_innovation: TRUE: The introduction of the Jack Daniel’s & Coca-Cola RTD as a new product offering in the U.S. market represents a business innovation for both companies.
green_product: FALSE: The Jack Daniel’s & Coca-Cola RTD does not significantly reduce its environmental impact throughout its lifecycle, as it is primarily a beverage product with no explicit green design principles mentioned.
green_process: FALSE: The article does not describe any manufacturing, production, or operational processes related to sustainability or environmental impact reduction.
